columns.text: In this problem, we are asked to complete the cash budget.
**Cash Budget** is a forecast of a company's cash flows over a set period of time.

To begin, we will compute the **cash collection from credit sales**. It is computed as follows:

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Cash Collection from Credit Sales} &= \text{(35\%}\times{\text{CMS}}) +\text{(60\%}\times{\text{PMS}}) \\[1pt]
\end{aligned}$$

Where:

CMS - Current Month Sales

PMS - Previous Month Sales

### April

We can now compute the cash collections from credit sales for the month of April using the equation in step 3. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Cash Collection from Credit Sales} &= \text{(35\%}\times{\text{CMS}}) +\text{(60\%}\times{\text{PMS}}) \\[5pt]
&= \text{(35\%}\times{\text{336,900}}) +\text{(60\%}\times{\text{211,500}}) \\[5pt]
&= \text{\$ 117,915} +\text{126,900} \\[5pt]
&=\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 244,815}}}
\end{aligned}$$

### May

Next. let's compute the cash collections from credit sales for the month of May using the equation in step 3. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Cash Collection from Credit Sales} &= \text{(35\%}\times{\text{CMS}}) +\text{(60\%}\times{\text{PMS}}) \\[5pt]
&= \text{(35\%}\times{\text{314,500}}) +\text{(60\%}\times{\text{336,900}}) \\[5pt]
&= \text{\$ 110,075} +\text{202,140} \\[5pt]
&=\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 312,215}}}
\end{aligned}$$

### June

Next. let's compute the cash collections from credit sales for the month of June using the equation in step 3. 

$$ \begin{aligned}
\text{Cash Collection from Credit Sales} &= \text{(35\%}\times{\text{CMS}}) +\text{(60\%}\times{\text{PMS}}) \\[5pt]
&= \text{(35\%}\times{\text{378,400}}) +\text{(60\%}\times{\text{314,500}}) \\[5pt]
&= \text{\$ 132,440} +\text{188,700} \\[5pt]
&=\underline{\underline{\text{\$ 321,140}}}
\end{aligned}$$

Before we complete the cash budget, we need to apply the formula for **total cash available**. It is computed as follows:

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Beginning Cash Balance}&&{\text{\$ xx}}\\
\text{Cash Receipt}&&\underline{\text{xx}}\\
\text{Total Cash Available}&&\underline{\underline{{\text{\$ xx}}}}\\
\end{array}$$

Next, **cash disbursement** is one of the components of cash budget. It is the outflow of cash paid in exchange for the provision of goods. Examples of cash disbursements are purchase, wages, taxes, and expenses, interest, and equipment purchase

Lastly, we will compute the ending cash balance per month. It is computed as follows:

$$\begin {array}{lrr}
\text{Total Cash Available}&&{\text{\$ xx}}\\
\text{Total Cash Disbursement}&&\underline{\text{xx}}\\
\text{Ending Cash Balance}&&\underline{\underline{{\text{\$ xx}}}}\\
\end{array}$$

We can now prepare the cash budget using the formula in step 7 and 9.
